channel.title: Loading dialogues from a cfg file
channel.description:
hey guys.
i was just wondering how i can load dialogues from a cfg file. it would save me some space on my remake, im remaking every dialogue from runescape

item.title: Loading dialogues from a cfg file
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“mrnessie, post:23, topic:525919”]lol that would increase lag[/quote]clearly you don’t know anything, meh.

i have two options (one being flatfile database (sqlite) and the other being mysql)
i generally use the mysql one when working with the dialogue configurations, because i can add to the database via a webpage (choosing the npc id on a dropdown list (or i can search their name) and then the dialogue text. i limit it to 50-55 characters depending whether i show npc head or not, and then split the entire ‘dialogue text’ textbox at every 50/55th character (if the character is not have a space after it, it goes to the first previous space in the string and splits the line there) after 4 lines in adds another row in the database (‘dialogue_id’, ‘dialogues’) and continues on and on.

the system works pretty great, and when im done modifying it all. i just save the database to sqlite.
the server doesnt lag anything noticeably maybe ~50ms when loading dialogues

but yeah. its better then xml/cfg/crap

Read full topic

            BufferedWriter bItem = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./blah/blah/"".cfg", true)); 
            try {            
                bItem.newLine(); 
                bItem.write(")); 
                bItem.newLine(); 
                bItem.write(""); 
                bItem.newLine(); 
                bItem.write("");

[/quote]why would you write to the file if you’re trying to read the data.

:([/quote]oh he said read not write
